availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Henry (Mercer County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, merchant and farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Henry and Isabella Henry. Married to Elizabeth Huff Henry in Mercer County, Kentucky, on November 16, 1858. Father of Wiliam Thomas Henry, Isabel Henry, and Richard Henry. Resident of Mercer County, Kentucky, in 1850. Merchant in Mercer County in 1860. Farmer in Mercer County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 362A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, District 2, p. 593.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mercer County, Precinct 1, p. 446A.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Mercer County, KY, August 1863, p. 14.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Mercer County Marriages, Film 000191863.
"John Henry (1835-1925)," Find A Grave, Memorial 70998770, accessed July 6, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/70998770.
